request_pathways.name: OCA-960 Authorization for Release of Health Information

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patients must call (315) 769-4386; no downloadable form or online request tool is currently available. The parent system's Swellbox/Datavant portal explicitly excludes St. Lawrence Health facilities.

red_flags: No ROI form available on any live website; patients must call to initiate records request
Parent system's online records tool (Swellbox/Datavant) explicitly excludes this facility
SSN field present on authorization form creates unnecessary identity theft risk
bright_spots: Uses standardized NY State OCA-960 form ensuring baseline legal compliance
NPP clearly states electronic access rights and HIPAA-compliant fee limits for electronic copies
Patient-controlled authorization expiration by date or event
Appropriate sensitive-information opt-in with separate initialing for HIV, substance abuse, and mental health

findability.rationale: Level 1: Effectively unfindable online — no form exists on any live website; all documents were recovered only via the Wayback Machine from a defunct domain.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 1: No usable digital form exists — the archived OCA-960 has zero fillable fields, a garbled text layer inaccessible to screen readers, and no electronic submission pathway.

content_design.rationale: Level 3: Adequate but with notable problems — the OCA-960 is logically organized with numbered items and includes instructions, but uses formal legal language, lacks pre-populated provider information, and has a garbled text layer.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 2: Patient self-access is an afterthought — the OCA-960 is a generic third-party authorization form that does not distinguish patient self-access from release to attorneys or insurers; no dedicated patient access pathway exists.

compliance.rationale: Level 3: Some requirements that may go beyond what the law requires — the form includes good baseline compliance (voluntariness, revocation, non-conditioning) but collects SSN unnecessarily, provides no fee transparency on the form, and offers no differentiated patient access rights process.

overall.summary: Canton-Potsdam Hospital's patient record access experience is poor: no forms are available online, the only current pathway is phone, and the archived authorization form is a generic third-party release document with no fillable fields.
